definition: to accumulate/to hold in store/to contain/to gather together/to collect/depth/inner strength/profundity

sentences.english: Having relinquished all attachment to the five khandhas, the citta is exceedingly refined at this stage.
sentences.chinese: 心已经舍弃了对五蕴的执取，在这个阶段极其精细。

sentences.english: When Bodhisattva Avalokiteshvara was practicing the profound Prajna Paramita, he illuminated the Five Skandhas and saw that they are all empty.
sentences.chinese: 观自在菩萨行甚深般若波罗蜜多时，照见五蕴皆空。

sentences.english: In short, the five clinging-aggregates are suffering.
sentences.chinese: 简略来说，五蕴的执著是苦。

sentences.english: Thus, the germ of their arising as well as that of their cessation are both within the Five Aggregates.
sentences.chinese: 因此，他们的产生与他们的终止都在五蕴之中。

sentences.english: What is the suffering of the burning urge of the five skandhas?
sentences.chinese: 什么是五蕴炽盛造成的痛苦？

sentences.english: The log is compared with Khandhas or human being.
The five skandhas burn us up and keep us in a state of agonizing pain.
sentences.chinese: 这五蕴炽然而盛，如火一般，烧得人精神痛苦万分。

sentences.english: Lonely silence can, from Ann at five skandhas are empty. Realm can.
sentences.chinese: 孤独沉默可以，自安者处于五蕴皆空的境界可以。

sentences.english: That is why we speak of the suffering of the burning urge of the five skandhas(24).
sentences.chinese: 这就是我们说的五蕴炽盛的痛苦。

definition: the Four Noble Truths (Budd.), covered by the acronym 苦集滅道: all life is suffering 苦, the cause of suffering is desire 集, emancipation comes only by eliminating passions 滅|灭, the way 道 to emancipation is the Eight-fold Noble Way 八正道

the Four Noble Truths (Budd.), namely: all life is suffering 苦, the cause of suffering is desire 集, emancipation comes only by eliminating passions 滅|灭, the way 道 to emancipation is the Eight-fold Noble Way 八正道/also called 四諦|四谛
actual situation/the ultimate essence of things (Buddhism)
arhat (Sanskrit)/a holy man who has left behind all earthly desires and concerns and attained nirvana (Buddhism)
the Four Noble Truths (Buddhism)/see also 四諦|四谛[si4 di4] and 苦集滅道|苦集灭道[ku3 ji2 mie4 dao4]
Hinayana, the Lesser Vehicle/Buddhism in India before the Mayahana sutras/also pr. [Xiao3 cheng2]
to extinguish worries and the sea of grief/nirvana (Buddhism)
